issues.description: Register-parameter ordering for the pixel coordinates is inconsistent between the problem statement and the code. In Teilaufgabe b) the problem text states "Die Pixelkoordinaten x und y werden in den Registern ebx und eax übergeben" (i.e., x in EBX, y in EAX). However, both the template and the reference solution (and Teilaufgabe a) earlier) use/expect x in EAX and y in EBX. This contradiction will confuse students implementing set_pixel (they may place x and y in the wrong registers) and can lead to incorrect behavior.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the register convention consistent. Preferred fix: update the problem statement (Teilaufgabe b) to state that x is in EAX and y is in EBX to match Teilaufgabe a), the template comments, and the provided solution. For example, change the sentence to: "Die Pixelkoordinaten x und y werden in den Registern eax bzw. ebx übergeben (x in eax, y in ebx)." Alternatively, if the intent was the opposite, change the template and solution to pass x in EBX and y in EAX and update all comments accordingly. Ensure the problem text and code use the same register convention.

issues.description: The mapping of pixel coordinates to registers is inconsistent between the problem text and the code. In the problem statement one place says x is in EAX and y in EBX (part a), while another place in the problem text (part b) says the coordinates are passed in EBX and EAX (swapped). The template and solution code consistently treat x in EAX and y in EBX. This conflicting wording in the problem statement can mislead students about which register holds x vs. y and cause incorrect implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the register-to-coordinate mapping consistent. Update the problem statement to state that x is in EAX and y is in EBX (to match the template and solution). For example: 'Die Pixelkoordinaten x und y werden in den Registern EAX bzw. EBX übergeben (x in EAX, y in EBX).' Alternatively, if the intent was the opposite, change the template and solution to match the corrected statement.
